channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'Strong and smart' - have Liverpool signed 'next Van Dijk' in Jacquet?
item.description: Jeremy Jacquet will join Liverpool for £60m from Rennes in the summer - but why are the Reds signing him?

item.title: Just seven signings - the Premier League's quiet deadline day
item.description: A low-key transfer deadline day ended with the fewest Premier League deals completed in a winter window. BBC Sport looks at the spending that was done, and examines why there was so little activity.

item.title: Two club-record signings - but are Palace papering over the cracks?
item.description: Crystal Palace end a horrendous January with a rollercoaster day - but are they just papering over the cracks?

item.title: Talbi rocket seals decisive Sunderland win over Burnley
item.description: Watch highlights as Sunderland earn a decisive victory over struggling Burnley, capped by an incredible long-range goal from Chemsdine Talbi.

item.title: Rangers buy striker Naderi from Hansa Rostock
item.description: German striker Ryan Naderi joins Rangers from Hansa Rostock, becoming the Ibrox club's fourth winter signing.

item.title: 'Disgraceful Spurs had 11 fit players' - captain Romero
item.description: Captain Cristian Romero says it is "disgraceful" Tottenham had just 11 senior players available for Sunday's 2-2 Premier League draw at home to Manchester City.

item.title: 'Pure genius' - who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Quiz: Name the record transfer for every letter of the alphabet
item.description: When it comes to transfer windows, it's not all about the numbers - the letters are important too!

item.title: Rashford wants to stay at Barca - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Marcus Rashford is eyeing a permanent Barcelona switch, Raheem Sterling rejects a Bundesliga move, Tottenham miss out on Maghnes Akliouche, plus more.

item.title: Palace sign Strand Larsen in deal worth up to £48m but McNeil loan off
item.description: Crystal Palace sign striker Jorgen Strand Larsen from Wolves in a club-record deal worth up to £48m.

item.title: All the done deals on deadline day in one place
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Is Benzema joining rivals behind Ronaldo's frustration in Saudi Arabia?
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's future at Al-Nassr is plunged into doubt after he is left out of their squad for Monday's Saudi Pro League game against Al-Riyadh.

item.title: Lookman joins Atletico - and will set new record
item.description: Atletico Madrid sign Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman, 28, from Atalanta for £30.3m.

item.title: Phillips joins Sheffield United on loan - can he revive career?
item.description: Sheffield United sign Manchester City midfielder Kalvin Phillips on loan for the remainder of the season.

item.title: West Ham sign Chelsea defender Disasi on loan
item.description: West Ham sign Chelsea defender Axel Disasi on loan until the end of the season.

item.title: Forest sign defender Netz from Monchengladbach
item.description: Nottingham Forest sign defender Luca Netz from Borussia Monchengladbach on a four-and-a-half-year contract.

item.title: Adamu, Arthur & Mvuka join Celtic on loan
item.description: Celtic have signed Austria striker Junior Adamu from Bundesliga club Freiburg, Brentford centre-half Benjamin Arthur and Lorient winger Joel Mvuka, all on loan to the end of the season.

item.title: 'Unacceptable' - Parker fumes at passive Burnley side
item.description: Scott Parker believes his Burnley "never gave themselves a chance" against Sunderland, as the side failed to manage a shot on target during the game.

item.title: Le Bris calms Europe talk as '40 points the target'
item.description: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris says he is primarily focused on achieving Premier League safety, despite a 3-0 win over Burnley propelling his side to eighth in the table.

item.title: Moves to look out for on transfer deadline day
item.description: Sami Mokbel, Danny Murphy, Troy Deeney and Mark Chapman discuss which transfers could impact Premier League clubs on Monday's transfer deadline day.

item.title: Will Man Utd miss Casemiro?
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney discuss whether Manchester United will miss the departing Casemiro's intelligence and calmness, after he inspired the Red Devils' to a 3-2 win over Fulham.

item.title: 'The front three are frightening' - how Man City punished Chelsea
item.description: Women's Football Show pundits Natasha Dowie and Fern Whelan analyse Manchester City's "ruthless" 5-1 display over Chelsea in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Everton sign Chelsea winger George on loan
item.description: Everton sign Chelsea winger Tyrique George on loan for the rest of the season, with the option to make the move permanent in the summer.

item.title: Wolves complete signings of Gomes and Armstrong
item.description: Wolves seal the signings of England midfielder Angel Gomes from Marseille and striker Adam Armstrong from Southampton.

item.title: Spurs and Arsenal sign Scottish youngsters
item.description: Tottenham sign Hearts teenage striker James Wilson on loan, while Arsenal move for Stoke defender Jaden Dixon.

item.title: 'Historic day for women's football' - but was Champions Cup a success?
item.description: After Arsenal won the Champions Cup on Sunday, we ponder whether Fifa's new competition has been a success.

item.title: Chelsea and Strasbourg agree 12th deal between clubs this season
item.description: Chelsea recall Mamadou Sarr from Strasbourg, with Aaron Anselmino to move in the opposite direction.

item.title: Sunderland sign winger Angulo in £17.5m deal
item.description: Sunderland sign Ecuador winger Nilson Angulo from Anderlecht in a deal worth £17.5m.

item.title: 'Statement of intent' - Saudis sign teen star Meite
item.description: Mohamed Kader Meite signs a £25.9m deal to join Saudi Pro League club Al-Hilal from Rennes, with Jeremy Jacquet potentially next out of the exit door.

item.title: Solanke scorpion kick helps Spurs fight back against Man City
item.description: Dominic Solanke scores twice, including a spectacular scorpion kick, as Tottenham come from behind to draw against Manchester City with a rousing second-half performance.

item.title: Sesko scores dramatic late winner as Man Utd beat Fulham
item.description: Manchester United avoided Fulham's late comeback due to a Benjamin Sesko goal in stoppage time to give United three points and continue head coach Michael Carrick's perfect start.

item.title: 10-man Brentford hold on for hard-fought win at Villa
item.description: Brentford hold on to an important win against Aston Villa, despite Kevin Schade's sending off during the first half.

item.title: Why I loved a deadline-day deal - and never saw them as a risk
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the right deadline day signing can transform your team's fortunes, but sometimes it is not just about the effect a deal has on the pitch.

item.title: Forest make third bid worth £25m for Celtic's Engels
item.description: Nottingham Forest table a third offer for Celtic midfielder Arne Engels worth up to £25m.

item.title: Fulham reject Everton's approach for Wilson
item.description: Fulham reject an offer from Everton for Harry Wilson, with the midfielder set to be out of contract this summer.

item.title: When is transfer deadline day around the world?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when the transfer deadline is set around the world.

item.title: Wales boss Bellamy won't push Ramsey on his future
item.description: Craig Bellamy remains unsure whether or not Aaron Ramsey will be available for Wales' World Cup play-off campaign in March.

item.title: Newcastle take action after young mascot left alone
item.description: Newcastle United are to take action after a young club mascot was left alone in the middle of the pitch before Saturday's defeat at Liverpool.

item.title: Watch: Late drama in Championship & huge win for Edinburgh City
item.description: Watch the best of the action from the weekend's action in the Scottish Championship, League 1 and League 2.

item.title: Mateta's move from Palace to AC Milan called off
item.description: Crystal Palace striker Jean-Philippe Mateta's move to AC Milan is called off because of issues with his medical.

item.title: Infantino apologises for jokes about British fans
item.description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino apologises for controversial comments he made about British football supporters which were criticised by fan groups.

item.title: VAR is taking too long - is a time limit the answer?
item.description: After another weekend of long delays during Premier League matches is there a way of speeding up VAR reviews?

item.title: Booed by some, loved by others - why does Vinicius divide Real fans?
item.description: Despite scoring a vital goal against Rayo Vallecano, why does forward Vinicius Jr continue to split opinion at the Bernabeu?

item.title: Who is in the relegation fight - and what is needed for survival?
item.description: Could West Ham, Burnley or Wolves defy the odds and secure Premier League survival?

item.title: Pele, borrowed kits and Euro glory: The FAW at 150
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks at key moments in the history of the world third oldest football association, formed in Wrexham on 2 February, 1876.

item.title: 'Pass forward, run forward' - Spurs' superb second half
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Troy Deeney analyse how Spurs mounted a superb second-half comeback in their 2-2 draw against Manchester City.

item.title: Naalsund scores two against Liverpool as Man Utd go second
item.description: A brace from Lisa Naasland helped Manchester United beat Liverpool, moving them up to second in the WSL.

item.title: Kerolin hat-trick sees Man City crush Chelsea title hopes
item.description: A hat-trick from Kerolin saw Manchester City sweep Chelsea aside in an emphatic victory, giving them a dominant lead at the top of the WSL table.

item.title: Late Mbappe penalty rescues Real Madrid against Vallecano
item.description: A stoppage-time penalty from Kylian Mbappe sees Real Madrid over the line against nine-man Rayo Vallecano, narrowing the gap behinf league leaders Barcelona to one point.

item.title: Man City still there despite 'setback' - Guardiola
item.description: Pep Guardiola insists Manchester City are still in the title race, despite a draw against Tottenham Hotspur leaving them six points behind leaders Arsenal.

item.title: 'Torres-like' Ekitike haunts long-term admirers Newcastle
item.description: Newcastle United needed no reminding of Hugo Ekitike's quality after trying to sign him last summer - and the Liverpool striker haunted his former suitors at Anfield on Saturday.

item.title: The most powerful woman in football - meet game's first female super agent
item.description: Super agent Rafaela Pimenta looks after some of the biggest names in the game - and has spoken exclusively to the BBC.

item.title: Nine siblings and a dog called Zoomer - Wirtz in his own words
item.description: Florian Wirtz sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his slow start at Anfield, playing padel and making Bundesliga history.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v boxer Francesca Hennessy
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on boxer Francesca Hennessy and AI with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Journalist dreams & Keane reunion? How O'Neill continues to revive Celtic
item.description: Showman Martin O'Neill continues to thrive as Celtic's interim manager as he guides the club through to the Europa League play-off round.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How many players are clubs allowed to loan out?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain the rules around how many players clubs are allowed to send out on loan

item.title: What happens during a football medical?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explain what is involved in a medical exam when a football player joins a new club.

item.title: What is a transfer deal sheet?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at what a transfer deal sheet is and why it is needed for transfers on deadline day.

item.title: How much do teams earn for reaching Champions League knockouts?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team breaks down how much money Premier League teams have received by advancing to the knockout phase of the competition.

item.title: Why do Premier League teams spend less in January?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why clubs spend significantly more on new signings in the summer than they do in the January transfer window.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Welsh's Well return for 'unfinished business' as Maswanhise stays
item.description: Motherwell insist top scorer Tawanda Maswanhise will not be sold this window, despite reported deadline day interest from Anderlecht.

item.title: Hibs buy Passlack and Suto as Garananga arrives on loan
item.description: Hibernian buy forward Ante Suto from Slaven Belupo and wing-back Felix Passlack from Bochum as Zimbabwe centre-half Munashe Garananga arrives on loan from Copenhagen.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Why are Paris St-Germain struggling to hit top form?
item.description: European champions PSG face Newcastle in the Champions League on Wednesday - but why have Luis Enrique's side not been at their best so far this term?

item.title: Bayern legend? How Kane is viewed in Germany as contract talks begin
item.description: Harry Kane is entering the final 18 months of his Bayern Munich contract, and the German champions are eager to keep the prolific striker, as German football writer Constantin Eckner explains.

item.title: Atalanta's Lookman set to join Atletico Madrid
item.description: Ademola Lookman is set to join Atletico Madrid from Atalanta for 35m euros (£30.3m) with the 28-year-old forward due to travel to Spain to undergo a medical.

item.title: What's gone wrong for Chelsea in the WSL this season?
item.description: Chelsea have gone from winning an unbeaten domestic treble to falling 12 points adrift of the WSL leaders - so where has it all gone wrong?

item.title: 'Not often you can write Arsenal history' - Gunners win Champions Cup
item.description: The inaugural Women's Champions Cup delivered the kind of spectacle Fifa would have hoped for when launching the new inter-continental competition last March.

item.title: How Man City have toppled Chelsea as England's best
item.description: Manchester City's victory over Chelsea was confirmation they are the best team in the country this season and they are the WSL champions in waiting.

item.title: 'Sweet Kerolin' steals show as Man City move closer to title
item.description: Brazil winger Kerolin steals the show with a "phenomenal" hat-trick as Manchester City thrash champions Chelsea to move closer to a first WSL title since 2016.

item.title: Cages, crushes and stabbings - is European away safety getting worse?
item.description: BBC Sport explores the safety issues fans face when following their team across Europe.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.
